025package io.blt.util.functional;
026
027import io.blt.util.Obj;
028
029/**
030 * Represents a supplier of results that may throw.
031 * <p>Like {@code Supplier} but able to throw an exception</p>
032 *
033 * @param <T> the type of results supplied by this supplier
034 * @param <E> the type of {@code Throwable} that may be thrown by this supplier
035 * @see java.util.function.Supplier
036 */
037@FunctionalInterface
038public interface ThrowingSupplier<T, E extends Throwable> {
039
040    /**
041     * Returns a result.
042     *
043     * @return a result
044     * @throws E {@code Throwable} that may be thrown
045     * @see java.util.function.Supplier#get()
046     */
047    T get() throws E;
048
049    /**
050     * Returns the result of {@link ThrowingSupplier#get()} if no exception is thrown, else returns {@code value}.
051     *
052     * @param value returned if an exception is thrown when calling {@link ThrowingSupplier#get()}
053     * @return result of {@link ThrowingSupplier#get()} if no exception is thrown, else {@code value}
054     * @deprecated
055     * The use of a default method here is clearly wrong and should never have been released.
056     * <p>Use {@link Obj#orElseOnException(ThrowingSupplier, Object)} instead.</p>
057     */
058    @Deprecated(since = "1.0.6", forRemoval = true)
059    default T orOnException(T value) {
060        try {
061            return get();
062        } catch (Throwable e) {
063            return value;
064        }
065    }
066}
